parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post encourages voting, it does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The post uses general calls to action ("Vote for our future!") without mentioning any specific candidate or party from the provided list.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags further suggest an attempt to reach a broad segment of the population interested in Romanian politics and current events.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage voting. While not explicitly endorsing a specific candidate, the timing (close to election day) and the call to action strongly suggest an intention to influence voter turnout. This implicitly benefits all candidates, but the lack of specific endorsements makes it difficult to definitively assign a positive or negative impact to any particular candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It does not present factual information, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it focuses on a motivational call to action, which is characteristic of political campaigning rather than journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post might express a personal opinion about the importance of voting, it transcends a simple expression of opinion and actively seeks to influence electoral behavior. The use of paid advertising amplifies this intent.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1108912597473233</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning any specific candidate, constitutes electoral propaganda due to its timing, its call to action, and its use of paid advertising to reach a wide audience. The intent to influence voter turnout is clear, even if the impact on individual candidates is indirect.  The post's motivational tone and general call to vote, while not directly violating Article 36 (7) - a (specific candidate mention), strongly suggests an electoral objective (Article 36 (7) - c) and addresses the wide population.  The lack of specific candidate endorsement might be considered a mitigating factor, but the overall effect is still to encourage voting, which could benefit all candidates.  The argument against it being propaganda would be that it's a general call to vote, not a specific endorsement. However, the paid nature and timing strongly suggest an attempt to influence the election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Daniel Prelipcean, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul "Sub mantia iernii, România își păstrează sufletul cald. Acum e momentul să ne amintim cine suntem, să ne ridicăm și să acționăm. Duminică, votează pentru viitorul nostru!", care, deși nu menționează un candidat specific, are ca efect electoral încurajarea participării la vot, influențând astfel rezultatul alegerilor.  Mesajul, difuzat printr-o reclamă plătită, vizează o audiență largă și are ca obiectiv clar influențarea comportamentului electoral, constituind astfel propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie. ID-ul postării pe Facebook este 1108912597473233.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
